HeroSection.title: Internxt CLI for WebDAV
HeroSection.description: Internxt CLI works with your chosen WebDAV client to manage your Internxt Drive files via commands.

WebDAVSupportSection.title: Internxt Command Line Interface & WebDAV support
description: Internxt’s CLI interacts with your computer via a series of commands. A CLI offers a powerful and efficient way to manage various tasks with your Internxt Drive account.

Internxt CLI acts as a bridge between your computer and Internxt Drive through your chosen WebDAV client. WebDAV is an extension of HTTP that allows you to manage files between your local machine and your Internxt account.

steps.description: Log in to the CLI using the internxt login command.
Insert the URL webdav.local.internxt.com and port 3005.

whyUseCLI.title: Why use a CLI with a WebDAV client
description: We built the Internxt CLI  and WebDAV support with the same emphasis on security and award-winning architecture for our commitment to privacy.
Your files are encrypted on your device before ever reaching our servers, and only you possess the decryption key. This unwavering commitment to security puts you in complete control of your data.
Remember to prioritize security when transferring sensitive or confidential data online.

downloads.description: For MacOS 11 Big Sur or higher.

CtaSection.title: Security meets privacy
CtaSection.description: Protect your files with Internxt's secure cloud storage.

HowToUseCLISection.title: How to build and use Internxt CLI
HowToUseCLISection.description: We have created resources to help you download the Internxt CLI and get started with WebDAV.

info.title: ReadMe
info.description: Information about the Internxt CLI. Find out about its usage, features, commands, and download instructions from our GitHub Repository.

info.title: User guide
info.description: Learn more about the Internxt CLI, how WebDAV works, and security features from our help center.

info.title: Updates
info.description: Stay updated with new updates for the Internxt CLI from our source code to find out about new releases and features.

CtaSection2.title: Manage your files like a pro
CtaSection2.description: Enjoy direct control of your files with desktop file management functionalities.

faq.question: What is Internxt CLI?
answer: The Internxt Command Line Interface interacts with a computer program by typing text commands instead of using a mouse and Graphical User Interface (GUI) like windows, icons, and menus.
CLIs are powerful tools for those who want more control and efficiency in interacting with their computers.

faq.question: What is WebDAV?
answer: WebDAV stands for Web Distributed Authoring and Versioning. Its basic functionality includes sharing, copying, moving, and editing files through a web server. WebDAV commonly uses HTTP security protocols to ensure secure communication between clients and servers.

faq.question: How can I install the Internxt CLI?
faq.answer: To install our CLI on your computer and start using WebDAV, you can follow the installation steps from our [GitHub page](https://github.com/internxt/cli?tab=readme-ov-file#installation).

faq.question: Is WebDAV secure?
faq.answer: Yes. When enabled, the WebDAV feature uses a local-only server on your machine, thanks to our CLI. We implement the same zero-knowledge and end-to-end encryption methods to guarantee the privacy and security of your files.

faq.question: What WebDAV clients does Internxt support?
Do I need to worry about self-signed certificates?
faq.answer: Internxt uses self-signed certificates for the WebDAV local server. While some WebDAV clients might raise a warning about these certificates, they are safe to ignore. The encryption protects your data regardless.
